content:
I'm glad you asked! I'd say the most challenging part for me has been learning the calls of the sparrow family. They all seem to sound so similar, and it's hard to tell them apart. I've been trying to focus on the distinctive characteristics of each species, like the White-throated Sparrow's sweet, whistled song or the Song Sparrow's series of descending notes. But it's still a work in progress!

I've had a few memorable birding experiences, though. One that stands out was when I spotted a Ruby-throated Hummingbird in my backyard a few days ago. It was only the second time I've seen one in my yard, and it was a real treat. I've also had some great experiences on guided bird walks, where I've met other birders and learned so much from them.
